intro: Elaphrium concinnum, commonly known as the narrowleaf elaphrium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is native to the eastern United States, particularly found in moist, shaded woodlands. The plant has slender, hairy stems and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in umbels. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a distinct, aromatic scent. Elaphrium concinnum is valued for its ecological role in supporting local pollinators and its historical use in traditional herbal medicine.
